thread.title: Arsenal stars face losing millions in wage cut and blocked bonuses if they miss out on Champions League qualification
thread.title_full: Arsenal stars face losing millions in wage cut and blocked bonuses if they miss out on Champions League qualification

author: dwright
title: Arsenal stars face losing millions in wage cut and blocked bonuses if they miss out on Champions League qualification

persons.name: jose mourinho kante keep him away n'golo kante

text:
EFL hit in the pocket Arsenal stars face losing millions in wage cut and blocked bonuses if they miss out on Champions League qualification 
Gunners facing battle to secure place in Europe next season that could hit the players hard in the pocket By Duncan Wright 15th March 2017, 11:27 am Updated: 15th March 2017, 11:52 am Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ARSENAL stars face being hit with pay cuts and missing out on huge bonuses if they fail to qualify for the Champions League next season. 
The Gunners are currently locked in a desperate battle to finish in the top four and retain their place in the elite tournament in Europe. PA:Press Association 3 Arsenal players could lose out financially if the club fail to qualify for the Champions League 
But it is not only the prestige in playing at the highest level in club football that is motivating the players – they could also be hit in the pocket if they fail to deliver in the final two months of the season. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
The majority of the squad have bonuses written into their contracts which would pay out on the condition they secured Champions League qualification. EPA 3 Arsenal were thumped 10-2 on aggregate by Bayern Munich and could find themselves missing out on the Champions League completely next season 
That figure is understood to run into millions – and the players could be further hit by being forced to take a reduction in their wages next season. 
Several are also believed to have a drop in pay written in should the Gunners miss out on playing in the Champions League for the first time since 1997. 
So any failure to finish in the top four in the Premier League this season will be felt bythe players as well as the club. Most read in football Liverpool and Arsenal fear being robbed of Champions League spot by Manchester United and Leicester Ron's Real nemesis Cristiano Ronaldo and a host of Real Madrid stars' futures could be under threat as Monchi comes in CAN'T KEEP CALM AND CARRA ON Hilarious moment Jamie Carragher snaps at Jamie Redknapp for interrupting his expert analysis on Sky Sports Brawl in Brazil Chaos in Brazil as local derby erupts into a mass fight between players and fans out on their own Luke Shaw, Anthony Martial and Bastian Schweinsteiger sent to train on their own by Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho Kante Keep Him Away N'Golo Kante celebrates Leicester's Champions League win over Sevilla from King Power stands Getty Images 3 Arsenal stars will miss out on millions in bonuses and some are even facing pay cuts 
Arsenal are currently fifth in the table, five points adrift of fourth place Liverpool although they do have a game in hand on Jurgen Klopp’s side. 
Tottenham and Manchester City are both six points clear of Arsene Wenger’s men but they have only played a game more. 
And Manchester United are just a point behind the Gunners having played the same amount of games, so Champions League qualification is far from a certainty this season. 
Should Arsenal miss out, then it is likely to cost them around £50million in lost TV and commercial revenue compared to this season. Arsene Wenger and Alexis Sanchez - Is the Arsenal love story over?
